IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSION OF WILBRAHAM AND MONSON ACADEMY IS TO DEVELOP GLOBAL CITIZENS AND LEADERS BY PROVIDING AN INDEPENDENT CO-EDUCATIONAL COLLEGE PREPARATORY SCHOOL, ENROLLING STUDENTS IN GRADE SIX THROUGH A POSTGRADUATE YEAR.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Wilbraham & Monson Academy's mission is the development of global citizens and leaders.Supporting Structure for the Mission:To prepare each student for the challenges of higher education and for success as a global citizen, we promote intellectual development, physical health, personal accountability, mutual respect, and commitment to service.
IRS990.Desc: PRIVATE CO-EDUCATIONAL SECONDARY SCHOOL ENROLLMENT OF APPROXIMATELY 417 STUDENTS. PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES INCLUDE INSTRUCTIONAL, SCHOLARSHIP, LIBRARY, AND INFIRMARY. WITHIN A CARING AND SUPPORTIVE ENVIRONMENT, THE ACADEMY MAKES AVAILABLE AN ABUNDANT OFFERING OF CURRICULAR AND EXTRACURRICULAR EXPERIENCES. ALL MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY ARE ENCOURAGED TO DEVELOP THEIR TALENTS BY MEANS OF THE ACADEMY'S MENTORING PHILOSOPHY CENTRALLY IMPORTANT TO THE SCHOOL'S MISSION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INVESTMENT RETURN FROM THE ACADEMY'S ENDOWMENT IS APPROPRIATED ANNUALLY, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE BOARD APPROVED SPENDING POLICY, TO UNDERWRITE A PORTION OF THE ACADEMY'S ANNUAL OPERATING BUDGET, INCLUDING FINANCIAL AID AWARDS, FACULTY COMPENSATION AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND OTHER QUALIFYING OPERATING EXPENSES.

The Academy has no unrecognized tax benefits at June 30, 2016 and 2015. The Academy's Federal information returns prior to fiscal year 2013 are closed and management continually evaluates expiring statutes of limitations, audits, proposed settlements, changes in tax law and new authoritative rulings. If the Academy had unrelated business income taxes, it would recognize interest and penalties associated with any tax matters as part of the income tax provision and include accrued interest and penalties with the related tax liability in the statements of financial position.
RENTAL EXPENSE 70,766. COST OF GOODS SOLD 204,841. change in value of interest rate swap -445,164. financial aid -4,020,700.
RENTAL EXPENSE 70,766. COST OF GOODS SOLD 204,841.
financial aid 4,020,700.

THE ACADEMY DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE AGAINST APPLICANTS OR STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF RACE, SEX, CREED, RELIGION, HANDICAP OR NATIONAL ORIGIN. THIS POLICY APPLIES TO ALL ASPECTS OF THE ADMISSIONS POLICY, THE AWARDING OF FINANCIAL AID, AND TO SCHOOL LIFE IN GENERAL.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: EAST ASIA AND THE PACIFIC - AUSTRALIA, BRUNEI, BURMA, CAMBODIA,
Europe (Including Iceland & Greenland) - Albania, Andorra, Austria, Belgium

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.SpecificServicesProvidedTxt: Student recruiting costs and Student trip costs

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: FINANCIAL AID awarded as a reduction of tuition charge

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FAMILIES INTERESTED IN RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID NOTIFY THE ADMISSION OFFICE AND SUBMIT AN APPLICATION THROUGH SCHOOL AND STUDENT SERVICE FOR FINANCIAL AID ("SSS"). SSS WILL ESTIMATE THE FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AMOUNT USING FINANCIAL INFORMATION SUBMITTED BY THE FAMILY DURING THE APPLICATION PROCESS. THE ACADEMY USES THIS ESTIMATE AS A GUIDE, ALONG WITH FINANCIAL INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE FAMILY, TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF THE AWARD TO THE STUDENT. FINANCIAL AID IS NOT A CASH GRANT AWARD. ACTUAL FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE REFLECTED AS CREDITS TOWARDS TUITION.

the HEAD OF SCHOOL, AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT IN ORDER TO PROPERLY DISCHARGE His RESPONSIBILITIES, AND FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE academy, IS REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN His RESIDENCE IN A HOME OWNED BY THE academy and situated on the Academy's campus. the estimated personal use value is included on Part II, column D as a nontaxable benefit. IN ADDITION, the head of school is provided with a vehicle for business use. the taxable lease value is included in his 2015 form w-2 as other reportable compensation.
the OUTGOING DIRECTOR OF FINANCE listed on Form 990 Part VII received a retirement payment of $26,266.
part ii column b(ii) is a bonus payment. this amount was approved by the board and included in the individual's 2015 form w-2.
included in column b(iii) for the outgoing head of school is a sabatical payment of $100,932. this amount was accrued and included in the organizations 2013 990.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: TO REFINANCE 2006 BONDS USED TO CONSTRUCT AN ATHLETIC FIELD HOUSE AND FIELDS

GrntAsstBnftInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipWithOrgTxt: PARENT OF THE CHILD IS A MEMBER OF THE BOD
GrntAsstBnftInterestedPrsnGrp.TypeOfAssistanceTxt: GRANT RECEIVED DUE TO ALUMNI STATUS OF PARENT

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: number reported in column b of schedule m represents the number of contributors.
THE SCHOOL MAINTAINS AN ACCOUNT WITH A FINANCIAL INSTITUTION THROUGH WHICH IT LIQUIDATES DONATED SECURITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The tax return is reviewd by the Chairman of the Board, Chairman of the Finance Committee and Chief Financial Officer prior to submission. The tax return is then made available to all members of the Board of Trustees. In order to protect the privacy of the Academy's donor population, management distributes Form 990 excluding Schedule B.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD IS KEPT INFORMED OF ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST BY BOARD MEMBERS. BOARD MEMBERS ARE EXCUSED FROM ANY DISCUSSIONS AT MEETINGS WHERE THEY HAVE A CONFLICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: the executive committee determines the salaries of the headmaster and officers based upon comparative salaries for similar positions and duties from data collected from peer institutions. reasonable and competitive salaries are based on the data collected.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
SEE SCHEDULE L PART III FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION REGARDING BOARD MEMBERS WHO WERE GRANTED FINANCIAL AID AS A RESULT OF BLIND APPLICATION PROCESS.
change in value of interest rate swap -445,164.
there have been no changes made to the organization's oversight or selection process during the tax year.
